uk.ac.cam.cl.intelligentgamedesigner.coregame

Class Candy

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.cl.intelligentgamedesigner.coregame.Candy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Candy
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Class that contains the information for a candy stored at a certain location on the board. This includes the candy type and the candy colour (if it is applicable). Note: this class will always have a candy type. Also, for the special candies extra information is stored for whether the candy has been detonated and how many detonations remaining. In the case of the wrapped candy a special radius is also specified in order to distinguish between wrapped - wrapped detonation (where one wrapped candy should have radius 3 and the other radius 0) while in the normal case it is just radius 1.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getColour

        public CandyColour getColour()
        Function that returns the colour of the candy. Note: This could be null if the candy type does not specify one.
        Returns:
        the candy colour of the candy.

      • getCandyType

        public CandyType getCandyType()
        Function that returns the candy type of the candy or null if it is not set.
        Returns:

      • isDetonated

        public boolean isDetonated()
        Function that returns whether the candy has been detonated (in case it is a special candy).
        Returns:
        whether the candy has been detonated.

      • setDetonated

        public void setDetonated()
        Function that sets the candy to detonated. If the candy does not need any detonations then the remaining detonations will be set to 0.

      • setWrappedRadius

        public void setWrappedRadius(int radius)
        Function that sets the detonation radius for the wrapped candy. Read the class description for further information.
        Parameters:
        radius - of the wrapped candy that is being detonated. That should either be 3, 1 or 0 (which are included in the GameConstants as DOUBLE_WRAPPED_RADIUS_B, SINGLE_WRAPPED_RADIUS and DOUBLE_WRAPPED_RADIUS_A respectively).

      • getWrappedRadius

        public int getWrappedRadius()
        Function that returns the wrapped radius for the wrapped candy being detonated. Read the class description for further information.
        Returns:
        radius of the wrapped candy that is being detonated (0 if it has not yet been detonated).

      • setColour

        public void setColour(CandyColour colour)
        Sets a new colour to the candy. Note: there is no special check to whether the candy type requires a candy colour or that a candy type that requires a candy colour was set to null.
        Parameters:
        colour - The new candy colour for the candy.

      • getDetonationsRemaining

        public int getDetonationsRemaining()
        Returns:
        detonations remaining for this candy, provided that it is a special candy (and that it has been detonated).

      • decreaseDetonations

        public void decreaseDetonations()
        Function that decreases the detonations remaining for a single candy, when these are greater than 0.
